This is probably not clear to most people so i'm pointing it out now. to play the game you need to copy the "startup.exe" from "razor1911" and put it in place of "startup.exe" in "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Games\Gears of War\Binaries". I don't remember if you have to do this for the install, but I don't think so. The game does run!
Also: Play the game in windowed mode so if you get the "wargame-g4wlive.exe" error you can just set it aside and ignore it.

For some reason the game won't start unless you set your computer's date back a year or so.  In researching this problem I found a Microsoft patch for the game that supposedly fixes the problem.  The game worked with just setting the date back, but I didn't get past the main menu without thinking "the game works fine, but it's annoying having to set back my date," so I ran Microsoft's patch.  Now the game throws a Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime error on startup.  Even when I uninstall and reinstall the game, it doesn't work anymore.  The game's now fucked, and it's entirely my fault.

Short version: Set your computer's date to sometime in 2008 and the game should work fine.  Don't bother trying any official solution to this problem.
